required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mass Balance and Metabolism Study of 14C-Z-215
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Mass Balance and Metabolism Study of 14C-Z-215 in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this Phase I study is to determine the absorption, metabolism, and excretion of 14C-Z-215 in healthy male subjects following a single oral administration at a therapeutically relevant dose level (20 mg).

primary_outcome.measure: Mass balance recovery of total radioactivity concentration in plasma, red blood cells and whole blood
Mass balance recovery of total radioactivity in urine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, 0 to 6, 6 to 12, 12 to 24, 24 to 36, 36 to 48, 48 to 72, 72 to 96, 96 to 120, 120 to 144, 144 to 168, 168 to 192, 192 to 216, 216 to 240 hours postdose, Day 15 (336 hours postdose), Day 19 (432 hours postdose), Day 23 (528 hours postdose)

primary_outcome.measure: Mass balance recovery of total radioactivity in faecal
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, 0 to 24, 24 to 48, 48 to 72, 72 to 96, 96 to 120, 120 to 144, 144 to 168, 168 to 192, 192 to 216, 216 to 240 hours postdose, Day 15 (336 hours postdose), Day 19 (432 hours postdose), Day 23 (528 hours postdose)

intervention.description: Single oral dose of 20mg Z-215 and 14C-Z-215 solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any race/ethnic origin
- Subjects will have a body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 and 30.0 kg/m2
- Subjects will have a body weight between 50 and 110 kg
- Subjects will have given their written informed consent to participate in the study, and to abide by the study restrictions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have a significant history of drug allergy, as determined by the Investigator.
- Subjects who have serum hepatitis or are carriers of the hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) or the hepatitis C antibody.
- Subjects who have a positive result for the test for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antibodies.
- Subjects who are exposed to radiation as a result of their occupation.
- Subjects who, in the opinion of the Investigator, should not participate in this study.
